KE / Domain: FoxJ1 expression and ciliated cell differentiation
AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: FoxJ1, decreased (Event 4); KER: FoxJ1 ↓ → Cilia #/length ↓; p73-FoxJ1 regulatory axis in multiciliogenesis
Input (manipulation / sample): Primary human airway epithelial cells at ALI; mouse tracheal epithelial cells; p73 knockout models; siRNA knockdown experiments
Method / Assay (SOP notes): FoxJ1 gene and protein expression analysis. qRT-PCR for FoxJ1 mRNA. Immunofluorescence or Western blot for FoxJ1 protein. Confocal microscopy for FoxJ1+ cell quantification. Co-staining with cilia markers (acetylated α-tubulin). ChIP-seq or luciferase assays for p73-FoxJ1 transcriptional regulation.
Output / Measurement: FoxJ1 mRNA levels (fold change); FoxJ1 protein levels; Percentage of FoxJ1+ cells; Co-localization of FoxJ1 with ciliated cell markers; p73 binding to FoxJ1 promoter; Correlation between FoxJ1 and cilia number/length
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Cell type and species; culture conditions; days at ALI; p73 genotype or knockdown efficiency; qRT-PCR primers and normalization genes; antibodies for immunofluorescence/Western blot; imaging parameters; cell counting methodology; ChIP-seq conditions; replicate number
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Marshall et al. (2016). p73 is required for multiciliogenesis and regulates the Foxj1-associated gene network. Cell Reports. 14(10):2289-300.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include cell culture and ALI differentiation protocol, p73 manipulation methods (knockout, siRNA), qRT-PCR protocol, immunofluorescence staining and imaging, FoxJ1+ cell quantification, ChIP or promoter assay details, correlation analysis with cilia endpoints
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: qRT-PCR assay, immunofluorescence assay, ChIP-seq; Mapping: KE FoxJ1 decrease (Event 4), KER FoxJ1 → cilia; Pathway: p73-FoxJ1 transcriptional network; Gene: FOXJ1

KE / Domain: FoxJ1 expression in airway epithelium (toxicology endpoint)
AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: FoxJ1, decreased (Event 4); assessment of ciliated cell population in response to environmental exposures
Input (manipulation / sample): MucilAir™ 3D human bronchial epithelial model at ALI; repeated exposure to heated tobacco aerosol or cigarette smoke (28 days)
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Immunohistochemistry for FoxJ1 in differentiated airway epithelium. Tissue sections stained with anti-FoxJ1 antibody. Confocal or brightfield microscopy imaging. Quantification of FoxJ1+ cell percentage or intensity. Histological assessment of tissue architecture.
Output / Measurement: Percentage of FoxJ1+ cells; FoxJ1 staining intensity; Changes in ciliated cell population over exposure period; Correlation with functional endpoints (cilia beat frequency)
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Cell model (MucilAir™); donor information; days at ALI; exposure regimen (dose, duration, frequency); fixation and staining protocols; antibody specifics; imaging parameters; quantification method (cell counting, intensity measurement); replicate number; baseline comparison
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Chapman et al. (2023). Twenty-eight day repeated exposure of human 3D bronchial epithelial model to heated tobacco aerosols indicates decreased toxicological responses compared to cigarette smoke. Toxicol Rep.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Document tissue fixation and processing, immunohistochemistry protocol, antibody validation, imaging acquisition settings, FoxJ1+ cell quantification method, quality control for staining consistency, correlation with functional assays
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: immunohistochemistry assay; Mapping: KE FoxJ1 decrease; ENVO: environmental exposure context; Toxicological assessment; Correlation with cilia function

KE / Domain: FoxJ1 expression in multi-endpoint toxicology assessment
AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: FoxJ1, decreased (Event 4); part of comprehensive airway epithelium assessment
Input (manipulation / sample): MucilAir™ 3D airway epithelium at ALI; repeated exposure to e-cigarette aerosol or cigarette smoke
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Immunohistochemical analysis of FoxJ1 expression. Quantification of ciliated cell marker (FoxJ1) alongside goblet cell markers (Muc5AC) to assess epithelial cell balance. Multi-endpoint assessment including morphology, function, and molecular markers.
Output / Measurement: FoxJ1+ cell percentage; FoxJ1 staining pattern; Ratio of ciliated cells (FoxJ1+) to goblet cells (Muc5AC+); Integration with functional ciliary endpoints
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: 3D culture model type; exposure conditions; immunostaining protocol; imaging approach; cell type quantification method; co-staining strategy; replicate number; comparison across exposure types and doses
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Czekala et al. (2021). Multi-endpoint analysis of human 3D airway epithelium following repeated exposure to whole electronic vapor product aerosol or cigarette smoke.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include detailed immunostaining protocol, dual-staining approach for cell type balance, imaging and analysis workflow, integration of morphological and functional data, quality metrics
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: immunohistochemistry; Mapping: KE FoxJ1 decrease; Multi-endpoint integration; Cell type balance assessment; Toxicology context

KE / Domain: FoxJ1 and ciliated cell gene expression (transcriptomics)
AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: FoxJ1, decreased (Event 4); transcriptomic assessment of ciliated cell differentiation program
Input (manipulation / sample): 3D organotypic human airway epithelial cultures; exposure to e-cigarette aerosol vs cigarette smoke; RNA-seq analysis
Method / Assay (SOP notes): RNA-seq for genome-wide gene expression profiling. Differential expression analysis for FoxJ1 and ciliated cell-associated genes. Gene set enrichment analysis (GSEA) for ciliogenesis pathways. Validation by qRT-PCR for key genes. Correlation of gene expression changes with functional phenotypes.
Output / Measurement: FoxJ1 gene expression (log2 fold change); Differential expression of ciliated cell gene network; Enrichment scores for ciliogenesis pathways; Validation of key targets by qRT-PCR; Integration with protein and functional data
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Culture model; passage number; exposure conditions; RNA extraction method; sequencing platform and depth; bioinformatics pipeline version; differential expression thresholds; pathway databases used; qRT-PCR validation genes; normalization approach; batch correction
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Haswell et al. (2017). Reduced biological effect of e-cigarette aerosol compared to cigarette smoke evaluated in vitro using normalized nicotine dose and RNA-seq-based toxicogenomics.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Document RNA extraction and QC, library preparation, sequencing parameters, bioinformatics workflow (alignment, quantification, differential expression, pathway analysis), qRT-PCR validation protocol, data integration approach
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: RNA-seq assay, qRT-PCR; Mapping: KE FoxJ1 decrease, ciliated cell gene network; Transcriptomics; Gene: FOXJ1 and ciliated cell transcriptional program; Systems-level assessment
